intro: Kickxia elatine subsp. caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian lesser catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit with slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pinkish to reddish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the dry, rocky environments it inhabits. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along the edges of forests in its native range.
